content.text:
Perfect! I've updated the Signup page to use the same layout as the Login page. The changes include:

1. Added the outer centering wrapper: `div className="flex items-center justify-center min-h-screen p-4"` (lines 46-47)
2. Added the max-width constraint: `div className="w-full max-w-md"` (line 47)
3. Kept all the existing form styling and content intact

Now both pages have consistent layouts - the form is centered vertically and horizontally on the screen with a maximum width constraint, matching the Login page structure at `apps/web/src/client/pages/Login.tsx:35-48`.

)}

content.text:
Perfect! I've updated the Signup page to use the exact same design system as the Login page. Here's what changed:

1. **Created a new `signup-form.tsx` component** at `apps/web/src/client/components/signup-form.tsx` that mirrors the structure and styling of `login-form.tsx`
2. **Updated the Signup page** to use the new `SignupForm` component instead of custom HTML/styling

The signup form now uses:
- The same shadcn/ui components (Card, Button, Field, Input, etc.)
- Identical layout structure with CardHeader, CardTitle, CardDescription
- Same error message styling (`bg-destructive/10 border border-destructive/20`)
- Consistent field grouping with FieldGroup and Field components
- A "Sign up with Google" button placeholder (matching the "Login with Google" on the login form)
- The same "Already have an account? Sign in" footer format as the login page's "Don't have an account? Sign up" footer

Both pages now have identical visual styling and use the same design system components.

content.text: Perfect! I've added `tabIndex={-1}` to the "Forgot your password?" link in the login form at `apps/web/src/client/components/login-form.tsx:75`. This removes it from the tab order, so when users press Tab from the username field, they'll go directly to the password field instead of stopping at the "Forgot your password?" link.
